definition: to satisfy rival demands (idiom)/to get the best of both worlds/to have it both ways/to have one's cake and eat it too
two/both/some/a few/tael, unit of weight equal to 50 grams (modern) or 1⁄16 of a catty 斤[jin1] (old)
all/whole/entire/every/complete
surname Quan
his/her/its/their/that/such/it (refers to sth preceding it)
beautiful/very satisfactory/good/to beautify/to be pleased with oneself
the Americas/abbr. for 美洲[Mei3 zhou1]/USA/abbr. for 美國|美国[Mei3 guo2]

sentences.english: For Merkel and the German political establishment, it's the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 對於默克爾和德國的政治體制，這是兩全其美的。

sentences.english: So, RIM could have the best of both worlds.
sentences.chinese: 所以，RIM公司的做法是兩全其美。

sentences.english: This gift will make you both happy.
sentences.chinese: 這份禮物就能夠兩全其美。

definition: to submit to the will of heaven/to resign oneself to fate/to trust to luck
to take the big picture into consideration (idiom)/to work for the benefits of all
to put oneself in sb else's shoes (idiom)
cheerful/happy
to not take to heart/to be free of worried thoughts/to adopt a lighthearted perspective/lighthearted
proficiency in a particular field (idiom)/skill in a specialized area (idiom)
(of parents) to bring up children for the purpose of being looked after in old age
to use one's brains/to think
pragmatic/flexible/to act differently in different situations/to accommodate to circumstances
to try one's utmost/to strive
it will cause no end of trouble (idiom)
lit. the exertion of lifting one's hand (idiom)/fig. a very slight effort
lit. wind past your ear/fig. sth you don't pay much attention to/in one ear and out the other
to submit to humiliation (idiom); to suffer in silence/to swallow one's anger/to grin and bear it
to rack one's brains (idiom); to take great pains to think sth through
stepping stone/fig. person used to advance one's career
